botanical_details.genus: Penstemon may be deciduous or evergreen perennials or subshrubs, with simple, narrow leaves and racemes or panicles of bell-shaped or funnel-shaped flowers in summer and early autumn

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile, well-drained soil in full sun or partial shade; in autumn, cut plants down to about a third of their height and spread a dry mulch; see penstemon cultivation for more advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings, division, or layering
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning group 14 (Pruning herbaceous perennials); deadhead to encourage a longer flowering season; in cold areas in autumn, cut plants down to about a third of their height to prevent windrock but leave some protection from frosts; when new growth appears in spring cut out old flower stems
how_to_grow.pests: Penstemons are generally pest-free but may be affected by slugs and snails, and chrysanthemum eelworm; 'Bubblegum' is said to be resistant to slugs and snails
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally disease-free but may be affected by powdery mildews
